An Introduction to Statistical Learning: with Applications in R Gareth James, Daniela Witten, Trevor Hastie, & Robert Tibshirani 2020-11-23 1 Preface This is a sample book written in Markdown. You can use anything that Pandocs Markdown supports, e.g., a math equation \(a^2 + b^2 = c^2\). The bookdown package can be installed from CRAN or Github: install.packages("bookdown") # or the development version # devtools::install_github("rstudio/bookdown") Remember each Rmd file contains one and only one chapter, and a chapter is defined by the first-level heading #. To compile this example to PDF, you need XeLaTeX. You are recommended to install TinyTeX (which includes XeLaTeX): https://yihui.org/tinytex/. I (not an author) am compiling this book for myself in order to learn both ISLRs material and how to use the bookdown package.
